com.raouf.android.muff.Helpers

Class HttpPost

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
      • com.raouf.android.muff.Helpers.HttpPost

  • class HttpPost
extends android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
    helper class to handle the http posts. to use construct an object passing the parameters as expected then call send()

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static interface  HttpPost.HttpPostListener
      interface to implement the callbacks of the http operation of HttpPost

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpPost

        HttpPost(@NonNull
         java.lang.String url,
         @NonNull
         java.lang.String postData,
         @NonNull
         HttpPost.HttpPostListener listener)
        constructor with the data to httppost and response interface for callbacks.
        Parameters:
        postData - string of data to send. should be generated using Uri.Builder Eg: String postData = new Uri.Builder() .appendQueryParameter(TAG, DATA_VALUE).build().getEncodedQuery();
        listener - HttpPost.HttpPostListener for callbacks of the operation.

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.String doInBackground(java.lang.String... urls)
        called when AsyncTask.executeOnExecutor(Executor, Object[]) is called, runs in the background thread. sends the postData to url using HttpURLConnection. if success returns the result as string , else returns null.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>

      • onPostExecute

        protected void onPostExecute(java.lang.String response)
        called when the background process is finished. uses UI thread. trigger listener onFinish then if operation was success it will call onSuccess with result msg if fails calls onFail.
        Overrides:
        onPostExecute in class android.os.AsyncTask<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>

      • send

        void send()
        executes http post.
